content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
												This is hands down my favorite FPS game of all time. I know I don't have much time played on PC, but on my XBox, I can say with confidence I have well over 1,000 hours into the game. I play it with a friend almost daily. When you have a good co-op partner, this is the only game you'll ever need. Terrorist Hunt is where all my time is spent, next to Outfitting. I'm constantly changing up my dude, finding ways to make him look unique- and it's just damn fun. It's also only $10 when it's not even on sale, and it's simply a solid co-op shooter that holds up even today! What are you waiting for?Pros:+ Fully Customizable character (and Camo, at Elite Rank)+ It's a bit finicky, but if you have a webcam and the game actually detects it, you can put your face on your character, or as memes for your dreams pointed out in his comment, "turn into spoderman." You can generally put any face on your character, to extremely humorous results.+ Solid Single Player Campaign (In the sense that it's fun and can be played co-op in it's entirety, the story's pretty meh. Something about a rogue rainbow agent, pretty sure he was voiced by the dude that did Adam Jensen in DXHR/Mankind Divided, and Joseph Kobin in Splinter Cell Conviction/Blacklist.)+Fantastic Co-op to be played in Terrorist Hunt+More mature audience, less screaming kids+Hilarious Terrorist Dialogue (There was one Terrorist Hunt mission that I did where all the terrorists were using dialogue and voices I had NEVER ever heard before. I've only witnessed this once and never again. It was on 360 on a map that I never really play on.)+No uPlay!+A level with the MLG logo plastered everywhere+Multiplayer (Co-op, not the adversarial stuff) is kind of still aliveCons:-No Subtitles. Maybe I haven't been looking in the right spot, but I can't seem to find an option for them. I barely understand what's being said over the comms.-Sometimes Terrorists are XxMLGxX420swagl0rdz, and will completely rek you without even aiming at you (Or they'll charge at you... backwards.)-Matchmaking can be super laggy (I also have 3rd world Canadian internet, and I usually wind up playing with people in Europe which doesn't help.)-Doritos & Dew Double EXP doesn't work on this title-Difficulty spikes during the campaign (IMO- it could just be that I didn't play it as much as the Terrorist Hunt missions)-That fracking audio glitch that is almost guaranteed to happen if you're not the host, and will never be patched because Ubisoft.Overall: Not bad,♥♥♥♥♥holes, not bad. 9/10Wow, over 100 ratings! I never expected my review to get any attention at all, and I know it's not an incredibly high amount of ratings, but still! To all of you who took the time to read this and rate it, even you weiners that gave me a thumbs down... thank you for taking the time to rate my review. *edit: Added the lack of uPlay as a pro, extra notes in the pros/cons, misc fixes.*edit 2: even more notes in the pros/cons section, and edited to not look like a wall of text.

Posted: September 7, 2014
												Hands down one of the best tactical shooters out. This game isn't your typical CoD style rambo shooter. It uses cover mechanics, gadgets and tactical witts to move forward. It allows you to play the game the way you want to play it. So before i continue, Yes this game's graphics are a bit meshy at times. They dont look as solid as a typical CoD or battlefield style game, but i enjoy the mechanics a lot more. Single Player- A story driven singleplayer that not only allows you to customize your character but also allows you to approach different methods to approaching your enemies. The story is decent and also has game modes such as terrorist hunt. This game allows you to sharpen your skills before you play multiplayer games. (Keep in mind people online may play like idiots). So as i continue this review the single player has a lot to offer and it's a very interesting game but theres a bonus to the story.Story/Coop- The story has a coop play that allows you and one friend to play the game and both of you will gather experience to level up. Essentially you can play the game single player, Coop or multiplayer and always gather experience to level your character. Multiplayer- tactical gameplay with firm maps. You always got to work together. overall this game is basically like a game you want to play. A game with tactics, and fun gameplay that you can play with your friends and enjoy.

number of helpful: 62 of 82 people (76%) found this review helpful11 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 17, 2015
												Vegas 2 is a hard game to judge, as it's not just a game, but part of a rather prolific series. So I'll touch on Vegas 2 first for fans of the series/genre, then as its own game.So first, for other fans: you're best off looking elsewhere, Vegas is no better a tactical shooter than Modern Warfare 2, "featuring" such inconveniences as mobs of enemies, regenerating health, and a crosshair that can't be dismissed. The planning aspect is gone entirely, and the only real strategy you'll see is queueing up endless "stack up" orders on the occasional larger-than-average corridor. It's a game that pays only lip service to its forebears and altogether a bitter coda for a once great series. One is best off looking elsewhere for a proper tactical shooter.But, assuming for a moment that the game were to exist in a vacuum, with no relation to the series, then the prognosis is a whole lot more optimistic. Vegas 2 is a rather robust title with a tremendous offering of content for fans of arcade FPS. While nothing particular about the game really jumps out, it's far greater than the sum of its parts. The shooting is punchy, the weapons feel real, the locales are sufficiently varied to never feel repetitive, and your enemies are truly a force to be reckoned with. And it's the AI that really shines. Each enemy feels individual, intelligent, and dangerous; they suppress, they flank, they aggress when they have the numerical advantage, and defend when they lack it. They're not perfect, and actually seem to be artificially gimped to make them easier, but you won't find many PVE shooters with the same caliber of opponent. The actual gameplay is largely preferential, but can be roughly generalized as a slower-paced Call of Duty with fewer enemies.However, unlike Call of Duty it's a pretty robust offering of content, featuring a rather lengthy campaign (with co-op!), numerous bonus missions (co-op again!), and a lengthy--if very grindy--levelling and unlock system to keep you grinding that treadmill forever. So, a note on each. The campaign features those wacky terrorists making another attack on the biggest casinos in Vegas, and Team Rainbow is called in to clean up the mess. It's full of cheese and stupidity, being just about the campiest thing since the 50-Cent games. The plot is further hamstrung by the occasional attempts at seriousness, notably as a few VERY contrived "tearjerkers". But! It's only mildly distracting, and serves as a fine vehicle to take the player to a variety of wonderful casinos full of wonderfully dangerous prey. As for the bonus missions, they take the form of numerous big non-linear maps full of bad terrorists with guns for you to hunt down. They call it "Terrorist Hunt", why, I'll never know. The maps have a high degree of replayability, and are just good mindless fun all around, especially with a buddy. Finally is the unlock system. It's all remarkably fleshed out, allowing you to create a new operative, customize their guns, armor, clothing, camouflage, gender, face, and turn-ons/turn-offs. It's a very novel system, combining the best elements of GI Joe and Barbie Dream House so much so that customizing your vanity avatar is something of a game in-and-of-itself. By locking everything behind an XP wall, it gives you a great incentive to keep playing and something to look forward to as you progress. A lot of the weapons are locked behind that wall however, so if you're not a fan of Skinner Boxes you're gonna have a bad time.So in summary, Vegas 2 is a terrible Rainbow Six, but a pretty good and very content-rich FPS. But make no mistake, it's no more a tactical shooter than Unreal Tournament so don't expect the second coming of Rogue Spear.P.S. Play on Realistic difficulty and if you're obsessive about firearms get this mod.

												This game is purely awesomeness. This will be a bit of a TL;DR review, so if you don't want to read the next paragraph or so, just buy this game. If you DO, well, here we go.Story:The plot of this game, for the time, was pretty inovative. You have the ability to lead a small team of 3 through various levels, taking out enemies. You can breach doors, rappel into windows, and more. It's something to experience, but nothing too special.Versus:The servers are too♥♥♥♥♥♥for things like this at the moment.The Main Event: Terrorist Hunt.Terrorist finds you and up to 3 other people against a horde of between 25-50 terrorist, each out to kill you. The team must use tactical strategies to effectivly complete each of the maps, which differ between them.  If you try to just run out and Rambo it, you won't last long. You can customize your loadout in the middle of a match, rather than having to wait until you either quit or do it beforehand. You can experiment with different weapons for each map to find your comfort zone. Each enemy will react differently. Some will just wander around aimlessly, having terrible accuracy. Others will literally kill you the INSTANT you run through a door. It gets you paranoid, which means you employ new tactics.This game is going on sale for like 1 doller during the summer sale, so buy a copy for yourself and a few friends. It's an old classic, and it's hella fun.9.5/10 would run through a door and instantly get my♥♥♥♥♥♥evaporated again.

number of helpful: 25 of 30 people (83%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 22, 2015
												Played this game back in the day tons of times. Good memories.The good:Graphics are a later Unreal Engine so they aren't bad.Highly customizable loadout that is made available to you as you progress through the levels with experience.A very detailed upgrade model based on experience and types of shots made. You gain experience points based on the shot you make, be it close quarter, long-range, assault mode, etc. Each shot gains you XP points for a specific type of ladder and each ladder (CQB, assaulter, marksman) has its own rewards and perks. Very good cover, concealment, shoot and peek controls. You can crouch or stand by a corner or behind cover, peek out and shoot, or peek out with zoom in function already selected, shoot, peek and go back to your zoomed view on your weapon without having to zoom in simply because you went into cover. Very useful when shooting multiple enemies from one location.You can choose an array of weapons, armour and equipment.When you have the gameplay mechanics downpat, it becomes super fun breaching and using different tactics when clearing rooms. The Bad:The AI is at times inept. They take forever sometimes to follow through with commands once you give them.The AI cannot throw a grenade competently. Frequently I've given the command for my squad to throw a grenade at a precise location, only to watch it bounce off a wall and land back at my squad and wipe everyone out. At certain times they will refuse to even throw one when requested.AI does not auto-heal itself. I have to backtrack and tell one AI squad member to heal another. Duh. Very fun as you're able to plan your approach differently - either going in assault-mode or silent.Overall it's a fun game well-intentioned hampered by some AI problems. Worth the download if it's on sale.7.5/10

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												Rainbow Six Vegas 2 is a much needed improvement over the original game, and it improved aspects of the original game's design without changing very much of the overall gameplay.The biggest addition Vegas 2 added was the ability to customize your character. Instead of playing as a gruff southerner named "Logan" you instead play as a customizeable character named "Bishop". Bishop can be male or female and his/her apperance can be heavily customized. You're given the option to pick between what clothing Bishop wears and what armor you wear. Which will impact how much damage reduction you get and how fast you move. In addition Rainbow Six Vegas 2 helped start the trend towards unlock based multiplayer. Now you played as a character who was universal across Terrorist hunt and PVP. And your character would gain stats in both singleplayer and multiplayer, which would unlock new guns and cosmetics. This was really popular at the time and reminded me a lot of multiplayer games like Syphon Filter the Omega Strain. These were all great improvements and made the game feel very fresh and new. It made it feel more akin to an RPG despite leveling being automatic and the game fundamentally playing the same. The multiplayer was expanded to have many more gamemodes. And Terrorist hunt was expanded to be much more customizeable. There's actually very little I can say that's negative about Rainbow Six Vegas 2 apart from how they didn't really change very much about the actual gameplay, so it still has the same flaws like the general stiffness to the combat. The storyline is also a bit weaker. And if you're a fan of older style Rainbow Six games, you're going to remain disappointed.All that aside though, it's a very effective sequel. And there's little wonder why it's more fondly remembered than the first game.

content:
Posted: July 3, 2015
TLDR summary: A solid tactical shooter, which takes itself very seriously (not necessecarily in a bad way) and is really up to par with todays games!I don't even know where to start.. Let's put it this way: I f*cking love this game!Since I was a kid, I've always wanted to become a part of a SWAT-unit. This game really makes me feel like I'm a part of that. With solid gameplay, great gun mechanics yet questionable A.I, it still stands out and can really hold up to triple-A games today. To be quite honest, I think this will be a better game than the new Raindbow Six game coming out soon.Below is a list of things I liked/disliked about the game:+ Great level design.+ Customisation is better than any other AAA game on the market right now.+ Playing with friends is really fun and enjoyable, since it requires a lot of teamwork.+ Solid gameplay mechanics (such as the cover system, which is where you'll spend most of your time in the game).+ The friendly A.I is REALLY good.+ Hilarious dialogue from time to time.+ Gunplay feels awesome, and really responsive/realistic.- The enemy A.I is utterly♥♥♥♥♥♥ even on the "Realistic" difficulty setting.- Lack of an FOV slider.- The plot has bigger holes than a hooker from L.A.- The friendly A.I is REALLY good.- Pretty complicated to join your friend(s) so that you can play with them.- No proper tutorial. I know it's an old game, but even back in 2008 tutorial levels were a standard.This is probably one of my favourite first person shooters to date (yes, even up at the top with Counter-Strike)!I'd recommend this game to anyone looking for a good time. 8.5/10 from me :)

												THE BAD: The game is completely forgettable with rather bland environments (you're in f**king Vegas and yet so much of the game is spent in warehouses) and there are a few bugs that were never fixed after the release. Also the textures are stunningly low-res and the graphics did not age well. Another thing: it's clearly a console port. But ifyou can overcome that then after a while the game grows on you. THE GOOD: the tactical control of teammates is nice and the AI is not that bad; there are many nice little tactical features that  remind you that this is still a Rainbow 6 game, despite it leaning towards the Call of Duty style; and the character customization is nice (once you download a saved game to unlock all the items, because who the h*ell wants to spend a tonn of time unlocking this stuff?).

Posted: April 15, 2016
												Buy this you ♥♥♥♥♥s, it's worth the pathetic $10 BASE ASKING PRICE+No UPlay if that thing turns you off, except for online+It ran pretty smooth on my old, ♥♥♥♥♥♥, integrated graphics card laptop+Essential cover system, if you stand tall and proud, Shotgun Man will pop out from behind a vacuum cleaner and demonstrate how much of an advantage cover provides+Intense combat, I can't listen to music while playing Terrorist Hunt because it breaks the atmosphere. It also ends up stopping my heart everytime I turn a corner and get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥by Shotgun Man because I'm too focused+Custom character, clothing colors, and mix and match armor pieces, and later on custom camo colors too+Armor matters, you can take a valuable hit or two at the cost of general movement speed, or run around in a tanktop and khakis and hope you don't get obliterated+Hella sexy near death effects, you don't hemorrhage from your eyes like in CoD, your vision gets impossibly bright and blurred, simulating how it feels to get shot and have a rib broken, like you're about to faint+Perfect amount of difficulty, the terrorists may have brain cancer which affects their basic judgement, but they still react almost instantly and perfectly aim bot your slow♥♥♥♥♥ On Realistic (the hardest), the terrorists just hit you more often than on those other, pathetic, weakling difficulties+HUGE assortment of weapons, and while they have more or less the same stats (the in- game stats are lying), different iron sights, recoil patterns, reloads, etc. make each weapon unique, so every gun is viable+There are still plenty of people who are clinging to Terrorist Hunt, and in the two games I've played of PvP, we almost got a full server going+Realistic gunplay, you can't iron sight/ reflex sight the whole game away from across the map and scopes can make CQC uncomfortable.+Its easy and fast to customize weapons, offered every post- game death screen+Leveling system, for better or for worse, I like it because it always gives you a new goal to work towards. Give up on getting Elite 99 though. ACES is a pretty nice system, which basically keeps track of how many Headshots/Precision kills you make, CQC kills you make, and Explosive/Breaching kills you make.+Ragdolls interact with one another, I have a screenshot of terrorist bodies piled on top of each other+Excellent map design, there isn't an all out long range map without some major CQC area. There may be some near- exclusive CQC maps, but Terrorists enjoy instantly reacting to your prescence and instantly killing you, literally.+Lengthy Campaign, with a nice story. TH and MP share maps, so they're both equally good ways to learn the dozen or so mapsCons?-That one weapon gun firing glitch where the gun continues playing its firing sound FOREVER, until game ends, pretty sure there's a fix though-Terrorist AI could be smarter, but being swarmed by up to 8 murdering machines has kept me and my friends entertained for this long. Mostly me-Terrorist Hunt is pretty Co op focused, so you kind of need at least 1 other player to stand a chance against 50 brain dead ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s in Murdertown-Can get repetitive, especially after Campaign is doneOverall I give this a 9/10, loses points for being repetitive after you reach enough play time to go Elite a few levels (I'm Elite 6 or something)Buy it you loser, you won't regret it. Unless you do

content:
Posted: August 9, 2016
 I played this game mainly from 2008 - 2012 on Xbox. Starting to play again but on PC this time. One of my favorite games. Much better with Keyboard and mouse of course, but the game reminds you often it was made for consoles.   TL;DR:  Weapon/armor stats don't mean jack, use what you think looks cool. Online is dead. In game weapon selection UI sucks. Great gameplay when it all works right. Tons of BS deaths. Difference between difficulties is extremely small (just play on Realistic). Majority of guns feel the same and some models are massive. Ok so real quick here. This game has problems. If you're unable to look past them I'm sorry. I love this game but in this review I'm telling it how it is.  Glitches: It's broken. I can't explain it. Just know if you get yourself into this you're gonna get mad and that pretty new razor is gonna be more like a toothpick when matched against your hulking Rainbow strength ok. I'm telling you. This game is frustrating becuase so much BS happens so often. You get used to it, and eventually it'll become just another part of the game to you. Sort of like dying in Souls. It's a fun game nonetheless, by no means a great game though. Multiplayer: Co-op with a bud is it *sad violin*. Don't worry, the multiplayer in this game wasn't the best. Customization: It's good. You getta change up your armor, very slowly unlock more as you play. I don't mind this I actually enjoy slow progression. You unlock camos for your armor (there is no camo on guns) and there are tons of camos. I try to use camos that I think blend with whatever envirorment I'm in. Most common setting is obviously an urban envirorment so I usually just use Urban camo. I like to use the Acu's too, as well as the blue russian camo. the first mission is awesome becuase you start on a snow map and everyone knows snow stealth maps in fps games are always awesome. So when you start make sure you get the snow camo going. None of this matters, it's just for your enjoyment. Doesn't effect how enemies see you at all. You can wear whatever you want. Don't pay any mind to armor stats btw. Enemies burst you down fast as heck no matter what so they're useless. Wear. What's. Dope. I'm telling you. With guns you can add 1 single attachment to each weapon. A few come standard with a sight, on those just add a different attachment that is not an optic. Story: Oh it's absolutely terrible. I'm not even gonna. I'm not. lol. It is very bad. If you play fps games for the story then don't even bother with this one. Then again, if you play fps games for the story wtf are you doing. missions/level design: Pretty simple, very predictable.  Always peak under doors  and you'll be fine. Enemies don't spawn in random spots, everything can be learned and breezed through. I look like a God when I play the first level.  psssst... Bring the SR sniper and an SMG of your choice. Remember that if you're behind cover and your crosshair is over an enemy while using a sniper, you can literally just blindfire once and it'll hit them. Or you can leave it over their head and scope in really fast. Sniping is very OP in some parts of the game.  Progression: You rank up in standard millitary ranks. E-* and whatever. You want to go for the A.C.E.S points that unlock new guns which are split into 3 categories.  Marksman (headshots, long range kills, shooting rope repelling enemies)  C.Q.B (close range, kills from behind, kills using blindfire) Assault (explosive kills, kills involving a shield, kills involving heavy weapons, shooting through cover)Stuff like that. Guns: This is where the game really lacks for me. Most the guns feel very similar to one another. I like shooters that have versatility in this area and this game is definitley lacking it. You'll feel their differences as you keep playing but the differences are small. P90 is a good gun. Aug is also very good. You'll find yourself just using AR's, SMG's and snipers. Don't be afraid to mix it up though. The Gun models are very large and bulky. The fov is quite thin.  How I have the most fun with this game: What I like to do is kind of play roles. Sniper, big machine gun man, doomguy, demolition addict, ninja. There's lots of ways to play. I love playing as a sniper with a heavily armored left arm and instructing my squad forward while I hang back and absolutely annihilate people with the SV-98 or the L96aw. It feels good. The teamwork when it works feels awesome and most the time your AI squadmates will put enemies down quick... but other times, they just kind of stare at them. It's frustrating, it really is. Wanting to love a game so badly for so long but being♥♥♥♥♥♥on by it so often. It's a love hate relationship, and she is one abusive  b**ch .

content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
												Rainbow Six: Vegas 2! This game was released in 2008 ffs, and the graphics are amazing for a 2008 game. The story definitely was not the best, but for a three hour campaign, it wasn't too bad. It's even more fun if you play through it with a friend instead of by yourself. The gameplay is awesome too, and very realistic which is a great aspect for a game to have. I would definitely recommend this game to people who love tactical first person shooters that require quick reaction time and teamwork!Some cons, of course, sometimes the sound glitches if you're not hosting. Story could have been a lot better, it got a little confusing and repetitive. Terrorist hunt is also super fun and addicting with friends! Buy this and play this if you haven't already. I wish more of Ubisoft's Tom Clancy games were as good as this one, for sure.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
												I love this game because I'm a total gun nut. I love guns, customizations, decorations, and doing that to my personal camoflage and armor. I spent hours enjoying tons of customization options and tweaking sexy sleek looks along with trying many different weapons. I'd say the unique feature of vegas 2 is the overwhelming amount of customization in being good looking. I know many people won't really find that to be a selling point but for me vegas 2 was an amazing game in that aspect.Gameplay wise, it's an okay-ish third person shooter. Very fun to play co-op and multiplayer with other people. I have had a lot of fun playing this with friends. I wouldn't hesitate buying this if you want to look for a fun game to blast some terrorists along with your friends. Make sure you find the mod online to increase the amount of co-op players limit on campaign co-op, terrorist hunt, and the tweak that changes the amount of terrorists spawning in a particular area so that you won't get swarmed. Have fun!

Product received for free
												This game is an amazing game. Single player campaign and Terrorist hunt is almost flawless, the only problem is team AI. Multiplayer is broken, the login servers are usually down. This game is almost a decade old so don't get mad if you can't connect, but sometimes I'm able to connect and play with my friends. LAN also works. This game's campaign is better than most Call of Duty campaigns and has ton of replayability. The graphics might be terrible, but its story pushes you forward and the difficulty can make the game easier than pubstomping in ace of spades or harder than beating Deus Ex full stealth on the hardest difficulty. I definitely recommend.

												One of the best tactical shooters ever made. It's aged but still the most fun on co op. Most games don't even come close to the intense and fun shootouts still to this day. I am sure now that Ubisoft has gone super mainstream, as in, every game has to be call of duty for them, we won't see another like this. It is unfortunate, but I guess that's what game companies want. Get your friends and play this shooter, after you have gone through the story mode, do the terrorist hunts. There is no better FPS tactical shooter on the market you can do this with. The controls handle very well, and this game is very challenging where you mostly get one shot. Sometimes two... but you better get your kill!The only thing I don't like is sometimes the AI is pretty kamikaze with no consideration for their own life. They just run in your face to cheapshot you. Kind of ridiculous since you are holding cover aware of your own life, the AI is not and could care less if it dies to get you. Doesn't make sense for someone trying to do what is being told in this story, but most firefights are pretty intense. Enjoy it and have fun!

content:
Posted: July 15, 2015
												One of the greatest tactical game, better than the first Rainbow Six Vegas In my opinion, not better than the originals though but Vegas and Vegas 2 are both are gems In my opinion, the soundtrack is awesome, the game is not too hard, even on the realistic difficulty, unlike other games such as Arma or even the previous Rainbow Six games, this game keep it simple, not too challenging but more challenging than most of the FPS of nowadays, If you like operations in Vegas, counter terrorism and team-based tactical fps games then you will love it, of course, it's not as complex as Arma and some other games but it's totally different and also better than most nowadays FPS such as the Call of Duty series, this is not a military simulation but a counter terrorist game where you can use stealth to kill the terrorists, you could compare it to Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon or even Brother's In Arms.It's a really great game that I would suggest anyone that likes Rainbow Six, Vegas and tactical games.By the way, if you're an tactical hardcore and your hunger of tactical needs to be feed with more than just this game, you should probably go for the previous Rainbow Six, Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon (2001), Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Advanced Warfighter, Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Advanced Warfighter 2  and Splinter Cell, they are even more tactical unlike Vegas which is made for new comers even at highest difficulty, but anyway, It's still a really great great game that should be considered as a gem.Other games such as this one but not necessarily hard would be S.W.A.T. 3, S.W.A.T. 4, Hidden & Dangerous, Socom (Console exclusive unfortunately), Metal Gear (unfortunately not on PC/Steam, the first and second in the series aren't on Steam nor even on the PC), Delta Force series, Brothers In Arms series, Red Orchestra and Insurgency, not considering Arma and Operation Flashpoint because they're way too different In my opinion but you could probably like them if you like this game but not necessarily, there are some more but those are the most known tactical games.9/10

content:
Posted: December 1, 2015
												The last true Rainbow Six title, a full fledged singleplayer story with squad mechanics, and a very good cover system.  Multiplayer is competitive and fun, with lots of customization and modification for both weapons and your character.  The progression system is lengthy, but fair.  Good weapons are available at the starting level, so there's no worries about teams having an unfair advantage due to equipment.  The Terrorist Hunt mode is a smidge bland, but that's usually the case when it comes to NPC stomping but it does the job.  Overall I'd give Vegas 2 an 8.5/10.

content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												This is a tactical cover-based shooter. And it is amazing. Unlike the Call of Duty these kids are playing these days this game requires "skill" or talent at especially at higher difficulties. This game is rather hard at parts on normal even more so towards the end of the game.You can command 2 allies or you can simply set them to auto-fire and follow you. You can set them up for door breaches and more tasks, tell them to use silencers and go passive (Shoot when shot at) If you prefer stealth. They are interesting charactors but not enough to where you care about them like a pet dog. More like a hamster.The story is great and fun, it is a fantastic story for a fantastic game.This game is highly customizable with many cosmetic options and gun attachments. To unlock the cosmetics you must progress in the game and get experiance for doing different tasks and level up your main level, you must get to certain levels on certain skills to unlock guns aswel. Some people might not like this but It gives a feel of progression that I love.This game has more modes than story gving it replayability, co-op, muliplayer and terrorist hunt. The first 2 are simple, play with other people with or against them. But the 3rd, you are thrown in an area told to kill a certain number of terrorists with, if you are playing with friends, some extra lives if so chosen. Single player isn't much harder as you can have commandable allies from the story mode. This is gamemode is tons of fun.Buy this game, it is amazing.

content:
Posted: April 1
												A fun game that seems to have been forgotten by time. It took me about 9 hours to complete the story on the hardest difficulty as a first time player.The weapon selection is good and very representative of the guns that were common in games from the late 2000s, and there are attachments for them. There is an XP system with unlocks for guns and ranks. The gameplay is very solid, with many tactical features such as breach and clearing and 3rd person cover. It is clear to me that a lot of inspiration for Rainbow Six: Siege came from this game, especially the inverted rope walking.The plot is very generic and throwaway, and the graphics aren't great even for its time, but the game is still fun and should give you your money's worth, even when not on sale.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 17, 2016
												Rainbow Six Vegas 2 is a direct sequel to the R6: Vegas. Kinda funny at that, as main hero is different but you control same squad. Still a tactical FPS, still without planning stage that older games had. It was released in 2008 and made by Ubisoft Montreal.It was also released for Xbox 360 and PS3. I heard that the only difference is that ability to put your face over your avatar with facecam is much improved in PC version. Oh, yes, and consoles also supported split-screen mode. No such thing on PC here.Technically, I encountered very few problem. First, quitting from gameplay into main menu would give me black screen. It was easy to fix just by alt-tabbing though. And second, I am still confused why bombs keep loudly tick even after your teammate disarms them. It's either very strange design or a bug too. It sure made some scenes quite awkward.It also has in-game achievements, but not linked to Steam. Hey, Steam overlay works now at least.As for multiplayer, it's alive. Ubisoft said something about not providing servers anymore long time ago, but the only thing it means is that you can't register new account in this game. BUT you can use your UPlay account instead, putting your email as login. And password as password.People mostly play Terrorist Hunt mode, which is incredibly fun. I also seen coop servers around, but this game was on sale not long time ago so no promises that they will stay. It supports coop only for 2 players after all, so usually people just invite their friend. There also were few versus servers, but people only play Deathmatch and Team Deathmatch now. Not every server was password protected here, good thing.And well, what can I say, it's a direct sequel and a much better PC port as well. Though this time it has global leveling system, so you aren't likely to use shield on your first playthrough. Which I am not sure that I approve. Talking of it, there is also character customization that also applies to single-player and coop, as you play as custom account called Bishop instead of Logan. And you can slap your face over the character head too. Most of the times it's going to apply eyes to forehead. Or you can apply drawing, if you are creative enough and willing to.And hey, at least this time around the game actually looks good. Much better than Vegas 1. Well, one of the reasons for that is because PC port was made with widesceen in mind this time around, supporting all the resolution. But most importantly, Ubisoft finally realized that applying brown filter doesn't make it next gen. What you mean that X360 isn't next gen anymore?Music and setting are much more varied around as well, it's not just Vegas now. Sadly, I noticed that sound seems to not always be mixed good. At least I had trouble hearing everything I am being told.Oh, and plot sucks. Alright, it's fine, but nothing amazing.There are very little new gameplay mechanic. I was dissapointed there, I surely would have loved it if they let you command two squads at same time. But nope, just one squad with same two rainbow bros. Oh well. I can easily list new features. First, you can sprint, with very limited stamina, always forgot that it exists. And more importantly, you can finally order AI teammates to throw grenades at spot you want. That pretty much means that you get 10 types of grenades for almost every type, if you can use AI effectively. Awesome. Also, look, finally have supressed sniper rifle.AI of your teammates were supposedly improved. They cover each other while advancing, one overlooking while another moves in. What I felt however is how often I would bump into their fat collision boxes while backpedalling away from corner, with them refusing to move away without order. And how slow they moved toward cover which I told them to, due to covering each other. Because on practise when you order them to get behind certain cover you usually want them to get there ASAP.Campaign itself is awesome though. Plot isn't as good, but those missions are much better. Still punishing, it feels more challenging. More good spots to use smoke grenades, sometimes more good entrances. Enemies are much more awesome, looking professional and with bad intentions, having laser sights to show off. And yep, they still show off personality, with all the behind-wall talks.Oh, and they brought enemies with shield this time around, so you know that you want to flank them while AI does frontal assault. Or abuse sniper rifle, it still works. And it still mixes open fight with room clearing, so you don't get tired of either sniping or breaching.Too bad that pre-last chapter makes you go solo. It's very hard, yes, but without teammates it's just boring sniping with smoking.Now, other modes. You can play campaign in coop with one more person if you want, seamlessly. You can't revive each other, nope. AI teammates are still around, only host can command them. It's easier with friend, yes. Especially when it ends only when both are dead in same time, you can just hide and wait for respawn.Then there is Terrorist Hunt. You can now play it with AI teammates too when in offline mode, but it still feels extremely scripted in how terrorists spawn. It's predictable and frustrating, artificial. However, once you get online, it becomes super fun for some reason. Terrorist spawn feels more natural with 4 players going around and it gets more intense, with difficulty being just right. Fear the terrorist with SPAS-12 shotgun, he is going to be your main demise. It sure gets tense when you are the last person online and there is only one terrorist left, with shotgun. You don't know where he spawned and they are really good at travelling around map.It does sometimes feel that baiting tactic work much better than actually clearing from all the sides. But oh well. Maybe it could use Hostage Rescue mode.Oh yea, there is Versus mode too. Maybe it was great in other Versus modes, but people play only DM these days. I tried. It was awful. People sprinting around, stopping only to shoot right into faces. Like other bad realistical shooters. Try to get more tactical in Team Deathmatch by overwatching territory and you are mostly likely will be called out as camper.But overall, the plot doesn't feel as interesting or urgent in this part and it doesn't have much of new, but it's still an improvement in everything else and is really good Rainbow Six title.

content:
Posted: October 3, 2016
												Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Vegas 2 was a dream come true in 2007 but now in the 2016 it is a unknown dream. Many people out there are searching for a good fps to play that is compatible, cheap, and most important can hype us into a PRO state of mind with competitive style. Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Vegas 2 honestly people stop searching for that fps its here its always been here! Vegas 2 offers multiplayer pvp and terrorist hunt for awsome teamwork fun. Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Vegas 2 is a tactical shooter video game and the sequel to Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Vegas. It was announced by Ubisoft on November 20, 2007. The game was released for the Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, and Microsoft Windows-based PCs on March 19, 2008 in North America and March 20 in Europe, except in Germany, where the game has been delayed. A world-exclusive first-look of the game appeared in the January edition of the Official Xbox Magazine. One of the biggest announcements of the game is that Logan Keller, the lead character from the previous game, has been removed in favor of having the player create his own character to play through the campaign. The player will assume the role of Bishop, a member of the Rainbow squad with a great deal more experience who is more deeply involved in the story. The game is billed as "part sequel, part prequel", as the events of the campaign run both before and concurrently to the story of Logan Keller and continue after where the first game concluded. Dont look anymore people Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six® Vegas 2 is here for you, it always has been.. Now go have some FUN! <3

content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
												This is a solid game.  A bit outdated but still very solid.  One big problem.  Ubisoft never fixed the sound loop glitch.  I've put in about 10 hours of play time and it basically loops machinegun fire constantly if someone dies while firing until I die or dissconnect and reconnect.  It is a client side issue and does not seem to happen if I host.   Very annoying.  The issue seems to crop up the most on the campaign co-op, occasionally on terrorist hunt.  I hunted the steam forums and google for a solution and there isn't one.  Apparently this has been an issue since the first Vegas and Ubisoft simply never bothered to fix it on PC.  Because of this I can not recommend what would otherwise be a great game.  You have been warned.

content:
Posted: February 2, 2016
												A great single player story mode that is made even better with the split-screen and online co-op options. Once you've finished this there are plenty of other online modes to play through to get your rank and experience points up, unlocking more gear and guns to use in the game. There's lots of missions to get through, so you won't be finishing it straight away and even if you do there are many difficulties to choose from. Although the AI, both your teammates and the terrorists have less IQ than that of The Only Way Is Essex making it a chore to command your team and too much of a breeze to go through enemies.Overall - great fun, very playable with a really good control system. Not all that different to the original R6 Vegas game.

content:
Posted: February 17
												Vegas 2 is a solid improvement making it worth playing instead of the first game. I liked the character creator and the amount of customization to your equipment there is, it makes you feel more in control of the game rather than it just being a linear shooting gallery with a generic protagonist that you have no connection with, having control with how your character looks in this case allowed me to get into the game more. I also appreciated the addition of a sprint button which ups the pacing of the gunplay slightly which I am ok with because I treated this game just as a first person/third person shooter hybrid rather than a tactical fps which this is really not. I feel like the developers knew this so they embraced the action heavy, arcadish route that the series has gone to which also explains the xp and level up system they added. Gunplay feels slightly smoother in general, I wish they did more with the level design because it’s all very bland and forgettable. I couldn’t care less about the story it was all pretty generic to me. Overall I had an ok time playing this game for its very short length.6/10 (Decent)

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 13, 2016
												This game takes the standards FPS military shooters of today, slaps a third-person cover system, and adds semi-realistic gameplay elements to it... and I love it!Rainbow Six Vegas 2 isn't what I would call perfect, however. There are many glitches and bugs, such as crappy server matchmaking, the notorious gun sound-looping bug, and possibly the best/worst AI I have ever seen. Not only that, but it is far different from the previous Rainbow Six games, (R6: Raven Shield and earlier...) but it's different in its own right. You still have to think logically, and you can't just run and gun unless you want to be mowed down by 16 LMGs at once by Mexicans in a local neighborhood. (Not joking, that can actually happen in this game) So I urge you to still give this game a try. It'll be worth your while, I promise.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2016
												Prepare to see a lot of [SPAS 12] and maybe a little bit of [UMP-45] on the killfeed.You're the one getting killed by the way.I played the 360 version of this game like 7-8 yrs ago and I pumped a LOT of hours into this game and it still manages to keep me amused. There are two things that make this game so much fun. T-Hunt (preferably with friends, realistic and high enemy density) and Customization.T-Hunt is pretty self-explanatory, there are a set number of terrorists per map and you'll have to hunt them all down. Sometimes it's easier said than done because most of those terrorists are insanely accurate and deadly especially the infamous SPAS-12 wielding terrorists.One of the greatest parts of this game is that there's a good amount of customization options for your character. You will gain XP from every kill and then eventually you'll start to gain more ranks and that means more options to customize your character with different armor, clothing and camos. Customizing your character is addicting as hell and it's kinda nice to see what kind of operators other players have made. There are of course those who run with their vomit colored tanktops looking like they are running towards the nearest convenience store getting their latest fix of their favourite energy drink. But hey, who am I to judge? If that's the character you want to create then so be it.You'll also unlock more weapons and slight XP boosts through the system called "A.C.E.S" this game has. There are three A.C.E.S trees called Marksman, CQB and Assault. The level cap for each tree is 100 but the weapon unlocks stop at 20, after that it's just an XP boost after another. You'll gain these A.C.E.S points for killing terrorists with different ways, for example, killing someone with a headshot or a kill from long range gains you some Marksman points while killing someone from close range or killing someone while blindfiring gains you some CQB points. Assault points are mostly explosives related and shooting through the walls.AFAIK the PC version is mostly the same except for a few extra bugs, the most notorious one being the sound loop bug which makes the game pretty much unplayable for off-host players. Luckily there's a fix that reduces the frequency of it happening which can be found here: https://steamcommunity.com/app/15120/discussions/0/616189106755568359/Overall it's a pretty good "tactical" shooter that still holds up. It's a shame that almost none of the recent games have this kind of customization as this game has. It's a great game to have some casual fun with friends while playing T-Hunt and also getting killed by terrorists with shotguns.AIM FOR THE HEAD

content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
												Alright this game is old as hell BUT after 8 years from playing it is literally THE BEST game compared to modern shooters -Customization : literally better than triple A games who promise NEW features but is exicuted poorly but Rainbow Six Vegas 2 allows customization on customization on customization. Which gives the player more to give into how they play either full armor with mutilple layers of protection or even no armor at all. Not to mention you can customize your clothes from head wear (mask, hats, glasses, or even a balaclava), to shirts (tactical, tank top, or even a long sleeve), to pants (tactical, assualt, and more). Also goes as far as putting armor on shoulders, legs, chest, and elbows (everything besides chest can be on both or either single side).-Weapons : literally the weapon choose is far just in my personal opinion if they made updates to add more weapons from machine guns, to shotguns, to pistols then have the ability to put more attachtments on a primary than just a sight and silencer (BTW you have 2 primaries automatically) then the weapon choices and attachtments would be golden-Ragdoll : MEN ♥♥♥♥ING FLING FROM THE HEAVENS WITH THEM ENDDING IN SPLITS -STORY : RECOMMENDED to play with a buddy to criticize the food court ($10 mother♥♥♥♥ing dollars for a hotdog) and the story it self is pretty much the same as every other tom clancy game where bad guy is doing bad guy stuff for revenge on good guy in simple terms (player is better than salty scrub good guy who terns evil).BTW dialogue is memorialbe with your character so i recommend you listen to his responses to allies or enemies. ( When he says "♥♥♥♥ YOU" it is priceless)-INNOVATION : honesty with Rainbow Six Seige here with them talking about new features like rappelling upside with a pistol has been here for like pre late 2008s sooooo-BREACH AND CLEAR : know when and when not to breach like if there are a group of terrorist then choose a BREACHING CHARGE NOT C4 to blow them away or a simple flash or even just open the door, dont go full operator plz with a smoke, breaching charge and a frag at once for like one guy.-AI : you can talk to your squad to move from one position to another and either be kill everytihng they see or sneaky sneaky but the enemies do give a good challenge stomping on you even on casual mode, SO DONT RUN N' GUN.- COVERING : i havent seen any modern shooter now that allows blind fire (can be done with ANY weapon like machine guns to snipers to shotguns you name it), peeking, or shooting from any covering position.OVERALL INPRESSION : 10/10 the best shooter compared to ANY other shooter highly recommeded to be bought totally worth $10.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 18, 2015
												If you enjoyed RB6V you'll have a great time with this game. The Gears of War style shooting mechanics are back, and better than ever thanks to the controls allowing you to map the cover button to your mouse thumb buttons for a change. Co-op is the way to go, as with the first game. Coordinating tactics is essential to surviving every breach. You get to feel like a tactical badass especially if it involves crashing through a window after rappelling down a building. The game didn't run too well when it released in 2008. But in 2015, it should be fine even on a modern Intel IGP. The steam overlay also works in this game.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 23, 2012
												Best tactical shooter game ever made, yet. It's arcade-ish yet realistic to an extend and keeps you entertained most of the time. Story mode is fun and can be played with a friend, Terrorist Hunt mode is very enjoyable and you can be played with 4 people (16 if modded). Can't say I enjoy the Versus mode much because it's simply full of the usual "online shooter game ♥♥♥♥♥♥s" and 5 year olds, but to be honest, not as much as the more popular games of this genre. The customisation in this game is amazing and there's an option for choosing gender, weapon mods, clothings and armour.All that said, the game has an awful sound bug that rarely occurs randomly, constant gunfire, aside from that and the bots with perfect but fallible aim everything is pretty much perfect in this game. They don't make games like this anymore. Ubisoft and Punkbuster aren't supporting the game anymore, but It's cheap and very fun, and still has a great friendly multiplayer community, well worth the money.

content:
Posted: July 4, 2011
												"I hate terrorists", remarked Sgt. Gen. Colonel NightTerror, as he reloaded his M4A1 carbine,  gripping its 14.5" long barrel in his left hand, eyeing the selective fire switch with 3 options (semiauto, 3round burst, and auto). He put in a 30 round STANAG magazine loaded with thirty 5.56x45mm rounds and pulled back the chamber thing. "These ones are revenge for my 45 friends you killed in a terrorist bomb attack when they were on a battle bus", noted Colonel NightTerror as he aimed down his AN/PVQ-31 Advanced Combat Optical Gunsight Scope. All the terrorists died because they were using bad oogabooga comrade guns. When the dust settled, Sgt. Gen. Colonel NightTerror walked up to Imam Mohammed Bin Lenin Ahmadinejad's corpse. "I'm going to need this towel,", he intoned, taking the Imam's turban thing off of his head, which had been splattered by continued M4A1 fire by the SOCOM Colonel, "to wipe the sweat off my brow.", he explained. by tom clancy age 5

content:
Posted: February 23, 2016
												Review is specifically aimed at the story mode for now, will explore the other stuff later. There's no actual spoilers, the spoiler format is just so it's easier to read bullet points in pros and cons if you want a quick breakdown. Also I can't compare to other rainbox six titles as I haven't played any others for more than a few mins.It's a pretty good shooter, but the story is WAYYYYYYYY too short, I'm already past it on hardest difficulty and I have several afk hours + I didn't realise about things like silencers till about halfway through, (I think it does tell you about it in the first level but I played that then got distracted for a while by other games soooooo...my fault)I do think the story is worth the sale price but not the full price so I will recommend it based off that.In terms of controls it's not bad, Cover being on mouse is unusual but works fine in practice.The high points of the game are the tactical elements, planning out the breaching of rooms, using thermal scans and snake cam to plan your route, blowing a door apart with a breach grenade if there are people directly behind it etc.Pros: Decent challengeControl of team is nice though they are a little too abusable.Shooting controls are nice but mostly you will want to avoid trading fire as much as possible.Good range of weapons and gadgets, nothing crazy just an ok selection of normal weapons.Cons:Awful AI,  I mean they try to cover and flank sometimes which is nice but you can kill a whole room with a silencer and they ignore the bodies and if you flash a bullet past their head as they duck into cover they come back out at the same spot for you to just blast it off gratefully and then there's the smoke interaction which is possibly the most tragic bit of all. Magical enemy spawns  make it annoying to plan routes, also ruins immersion and makes it frustrating when someone appears in a spot you had checked very carefully just seconds before, (I'm not talking about people roping in, I mean literal sudden appearences Silly Last "boss" scene.Story mode is way too short, it has like 4-6 hours total of play even at a casual enough pace with several deaths.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 2
Unpolished diamond (THIS GAME NEEDS A GOOD REMAKE) its a great game with a lot of potential that have been left apart.Pros: -Fun and hard tactic coop first person shooter.-Lots of possibilites in customization of character.-Modes like Terrorist Hunt, Demolition, Conquest, Deathmatch, History and more.-Fair quantity of maps (Would be cool like 3 more with another ambientation, like a forest or a place with snow).-Fair quantity of guns (Would be cool like 2 more in every category and rebalance some of them).-While playing you can unlock lot of things like guns, armor parts, helmets, masks, colours and more (Yep, for free, no DLC crap)-Completely replayable, you will keep earning experience points and earning things, the bots are really random so every time you play will be different.-3 difficulty levels (PLAY IT ON REALISTIC).-Good joystick support, I know that no one plays with joystick these games but some times I do.-The game can turn into a survival horror when you are playing Terrorist Hunt and you end up alone versus 1-5 terrorists.-Graphics and physics are good for a 2008 game.Cons: -No Split-Screen in PC, is a coop based game I don´t understand why remove this function in PC.-Graphical bugs like bodies trasspasing walls, floors, some texture and lightning blinks when you look at them.-Some guns are unbalanced, I know this sounds stupid but more stupid is that you have to empty your entire ammunition clip to kill only two enemies.-The bots (A.I) are completely random, they don´t react properly at the situations like they are completely blinds or deaf, if they saw you or heard you shoot some ones wouldn´t react, some times they insta spawn near around you (This is really ♥♥♥♥ed up) and my favourite, you walk slowly around a corner and they insta kill you from nowhere. And yes the friendly bots are dumb too more dumb than the terrorist, they walk in front of your shooting and make you lose the game.-Enemy quotes, the mexican voices are really funny but with the time it will become repetitive and annoying.-The online is dead, well its a 2008 unfinished game.-Your character will die if he falls from 40 inches, not funny Ubisoft.-The third person cover system is overpowered, can make the game really easy in any mode, should be removed or reworked.-Some times there could be a sound bug when a gun shoots that its really annoying.-There are some gun models that look terrible like the Desert Eagle things like this shows that the game was rushed to put it on sale.-Dead bodies and blood dissapear when you stop looking at it.8/10Why so good calification if you said a lot of negative things about it? Well the game is good, playable, enjoyable and fun, most of that negative things could be fixed with only ONE PATCH that never will arrive, I recommend playing this game with friends and hope for a good remake without Uplay, without pathetic DLC´s, with Split-Screen and other more surprises. "ESE ALGUIEN ERES TÚ AMIGO"Mexican Terrorist 2008-2008 Never forget.

Posted: October 1, 2015
												The first time I played this game was when it frist came out on the Xbox 360, and I had a blast in co-op with my friend. Now here I am, almost 8 years later, writing this review for the game I enjoyed so long ago. And even till this day, I still love it. Now I may be excited for Seige to come out, but this will always be my favorite game in the Rainbow Six series. If I could add on my hours from the Xbox, I bet my bottom dollar that I would rack up over 300 hours in this game. Thats how much replay value this game has. Seige may possibly be a great game, but it will never come close to what Vegas 2 had to offer in its day and age.

content:
Posted: April 11, 2014
												Quality gameplay and mechanics that mesh together seamlessly to create an enjoyable and smooth experience only slightly balances out the nigh-irredeemable scars of a console port. The FOV is locked to a sub-70 angle, (and Ubisoft's excuse is quite literally saying "we cannot be arsed") meaning that a lot of the time, you're going to be killed by something you didn't see, and the controls, while fortunately rebindable, are hard to use at best and unmanagable at worst. The optimization and slew of resolutions and aspect ratios are done well enough to nearly excuse the lack of an in-depth options menu and slightly disruptive online interface. I recommend this game on the grounds that if you can get past the bad, the game is solid enough to warrant continued play. Much in the same sense that a flan is still good, if you can get past it being in the bottom of a bin.

content:
Posted: March 20, 2014
												I've been coming to the conclusion that most Tom Clancy games make for amazing coop games. My friend and I have been playing this on ps3 together for the past few years and love every minute of this game. I ended up getting it on PC too so I could have my own copy.The gameplay is rich and interesting. Everything is a bit more realistic, so you actually have to be tactical or you'll die quickly. The coop is fun as you can plan and execute maneuvers into rooms. There is a wide variety of weapons  and tools you can use too.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
												The latest in Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Saga, it is truly a blast to play.Take the lead of a small group of spec op's as they raid the most corrupt parts of Sin City.The gunplay and control mechanics are where this game shines. Each gun feels and sounds as it should.You can give you squad commands to open/hold fire, raid rooms with flash/frag grenades and more!Playing on Realistic mode is the way to go because everyone responds to the bullet locations as they would in real life, including you.The game itself is amazing and I really enjoy it, but I can't jump up and down recommending the PC port.Ubisoft has a pretty solid track record of buggy PC ports, this one is no different. At a lot of times I found my squad not responding. However if you're good a shooting you can still progress in the game. I recommend it for fans of Tom Clancy's franchises and of military shooters.7.5/10

												Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Vegas 2-смесь тактического шутера от первого и третьего лица.Есть механика стрельбы из укрытий,вынос дверей и хорошая слаженость в команде.Присутствует мультиплеер,охота на террористов(до 4-ых игроков) и кооперативная кампания(для 2-их игроков).Содержит множество элементов тактического шутера(командные действия, возможность отдавать приказы, есть возможность выбирать стиль прохождения).Мне нравится ещё один момент-редактор персонажа(можно менять внешность,пол,характеристики и снаряжение).Игра очень похожа на SWAT4.Так же надо всё обдумать.Где то нужно пройти не обнаружив себя,где то кинуть слеповуху и за штурмовать помещение.Игра вообщем очень хорошая.8\10

Posted: January 12, 2016
There are many ways to play Rainbow Six, but i challenge anyone to play the way I do:~No armor, ever.~Raging bull or Deag only, whichever you acquire first.~Play as a black guy with full facial hair, Green boonie hat, Black sweats, Blue tank top and Retro sunglasses.~Carry two snipers for those desparate times, noscopes only.Also, keep in mind I play on the only difficulty the game has, "Realistic" WHAT ARE YOU DOING? AIM AND SHOOT! ~Every terrorist in the game♥♥♥♥. YOU. ~Bishop, my main man.SHOOT THE ♥♥♥♥ER! ~Another pesky terroristOn a serious note, I've played this game on console since it first came out and I've loved every second of it. It really challenges you to use everything you have, especially on Realistic. A classic, must have for anyone who likes salty terrorists, or if you want to use your brain in an FPS/3PS.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7, 2016
												Pretty Good Game Review Considering (PGGRC) 9 Hours to Complete (Played 75 Hours On Xbox 360) TL;DR: One of the better Tom Clancy games out there offering an unmatched amount of customization that really affects how you tackle missions while also having a lot of different modes. This game even now is one of my favourites and what modern shooters should look back to. Where games were hard if you dident plan, bring in the right equipment or generally werent on point. Performance: Great. The game is old and dated graphically so you wont have performance problems.Graphics: Dated. Its an old game so dont expect anything good. Still looks nice and a good representation of Vegas casinos. Gameplay: Solid. A range of weaponary. Different weaponary affect how you can engage a mission more effectivily. Attachment customization is a little weak only choosing one attachment. Though it does make you value if you want a sight, extended mag or a laser sight. However what customization aint weak it the equipment.The best gear customization is anygame to this date. Why? Because not only can you mix and match armour pieces, change them visually but they actually affect gameplay. You can choose to have tanky armour or light armour or a mixture of the two. This immediatly changes how you choose to play. The AI is unreliable. Sometimes very clever: flashing banging and flanking you before you can even fight back. But sometimes brain dead: Staring at a wall or watching their friends head pop right next to them without even firing at you. Story is generic. It gets you to each mission but overall is weak. Replayability: Quite alot. If it aint the singleplayer, its the great terriorist hunt mode with tons of maps or the team focus multiplayerConclusion: Overall this game is great. To this game no game has this much of customization which is a crime. Gameplay is solid as it actually challenges you making you regret rushing into an engagment. It makes you think before you shoot and thats hard to find it games today. If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow my curator group: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/FALLENV3GAS#curation

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 4, 2015
												Scar CQC AR has a 7.62x51mm round, but still has less penetration than a 5.56x45mm G36     Realism is 0/6.9But seriously though, this game is a tactical FPS. This isn't Battlefield and it sure isn't Call of Duty.  Every corner, every room, you need to plan ahead. Multiple terrorist could be hiding with 12 gauge buckshot for your face, and you aren't going to survive that. Choose your type of entry point, whether it is rappelling down the side of a building, or just breach charging the door.(It may seem like I have not played this game very much, but I launch the game from a program that allows me to run it windowed.)Pros:+ Different tactics to apply to each unique situation+ Customization on characters and weapons is quite extensive, more than most similar games now+ Map Design is great for open ended gunfights+ A.I. are smarter than the average COD player+ Great Cover system is now your new home for the rest of the game+ COOP is awesome fun, I blow up my friends everytime and they cri :D+ Gunplay is fun and satisfyingCons:- The plot is worse than the 9/11 conspiracy- Wish I didn't have to make my own tutorial (First mission is technically a Tutorial, but not a very good one)- No adjustable FOV makes me feel like I'm wearing a VR headset while riding a real roller coaster- Joining or having friends join you is a bit of a pain to work out- Cover System makes you Jesus- No windowed option (More of a personal preference than an actually con)Vegas 2 is a must-have classic Tom Clancy title. It is the definition of Tactical Shooters, and one of my favorite all-time FPS games. Although, you still can have hilarious shenanigans with your friends. I rate it 8.75/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
												To start off, Rainbow Six Vegas two is a pretty good game for how old it is and for it's price.It still does have people playing it, so if you have no friends you don't have to worry as the multiplayer is not dead.First off, there is a campaign that can be played with 1 other player. The campaign does have a good amount of missions and content, but the actual story overall is not that great.There is also Terrorist Hunt which can be played with 3 other players maximum.As you rank up, you can further customize your operator with new pieces of camouflage, armor, tactical goggles, balaclavas, masks and more. Which you can spend a good amount of time just customizing your character.On a side note, the actual character faces are not that great, but with the PC version of this game, with a webcam you can actually use your own face (or use a picture of something else like a bear) for your character's face.But the game also does have some problems with audio which I have experimented on with the PC version and the one ported to Xbox 1, there is errors when you might shoot a terrorist/NPC while they're shooting and the gunshots will not stop until you reach a new scene/finish the terrorist hunt mission, it can get very annoying and confusing as all you hear is that gunshots over mostly everything else.I have also tested playing this on PC with a  Logitech Gamepad F310, and a Xbox 1 controller with connected in with a adapter. Neither of them worked (and to check so I could rule out user error I checked the options and tried to enable the ''Xbox 360 controller'' and also tried using the controllers on different games like GTA 5 in which they did work.)Overall, I would recommend this game definitely at least if it was 50% off if you just wanted to play something new for a little.

content:
Posted: February 13, 2011
												Ah Rainbow Six... how far you've fallen. That said, Vegas 2 is a good example of how tactical shooters can work in the mainstream market. There's a solid array of equipment, the rank-up system is surprisingly well-done, and the game mechanics generally work pretty well. Unfortunately, it's too easy (when you can lone wolf the entire game without much consequence, you have a problem), too short, the story sucks, and the multiplayer's completely broken on PC. You'll probably want to avoid it if you're a die-hard Rainbow Six fan, but for newcomers to the series it's worth looking at.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
												This game is an awful, ♥♥♥♥♥♥, buggy mess, and has some of the worst, glitchies, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t-iest AI I've ever seen in a game... BUT I CAN'T STOP PLAYING IT! Despite all of the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, and the glitches, this game is one of the few games that has this level of character customization. As you play through the game, no matter what you're doing, you're ranking up what the game calls "A.C.E.S.", which unlocks new weapons and equipment, and ranking up your overall level unlocks new clothing and armor items for your character, and even a bunch of real-world accurate camouflage patterns. Eventually you'll even unlock the ability to create your own custom camouflage patterns, so that you can look like a pink and purple tanktop wearing♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ or spiderman! And that's not all! There's a feature that allows you to use a webcam to capture your face (or even something that isn't your face) and impose it over your character's face! The possibilities are endless!  Not only that, but this game has a campaign that you can play fully co-operatively with a friend, and terrorist hunt mode, a returning mode from previous Rainbow Six games, which allows you and up to three buddies to take on multiplayer maps that are swarming with terrorists, the goal obviously being to eliminate them all. The big downfalls of this game are the glitchy, awful AI, and the terrible advarsarial/pvp multiplayer gameplay. The AI can sometimes see and shoot you through a solid wall if they manage to somehow stick the muzzle of their gun through it, and the pvp multiplayer is just plain trash to be honest. If any of the fun things I've mentioned in this review sound like your cup of tea, and you feel like you can dismiss or ignore the glaring AI issues in the game, then I highly recommend this game. If you're a stickler for well polished games, however, this one is not for you. The glitches are impossible to overlook, and sometimes they're just plain awful to have to put up with. This game would've been actually good if the AI wasn't such a botched mess. I can barely recommend it to anyone, but there is some fun to be had. Buy it on sale for cheap.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 3, 2014
												An old classic, this realistic simulator puts you into the eyes of a Rainbow Six squad member, a highly trained anti-terrorist police task force.Single player is very fun and interesting, throwing you into a tale of betrayal. Multiplayer is even better, having many guns and maps with randomized enemy placement, making replay countless.Play with up to 3 others, allowing you to chat to others in a realistic enviroment, forcing you to move slowly and listen carefully for the movement of enemies. If you play on realistic difficulty, the terrorists will usually will kill you incredible fast, even with heavy armour. This makes for strategic play and a high requirement for team skill.Being pretty old, the AI isn't the smartest and they have near 100% accuracy.The graphics are slightly pasty and the friendly AI in single player is slightly incompetent at times.All in all, one of the best multiplayer CO-OP games I've ever played.Personal Rating: 4/5

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2015
												★ ★ ★ -  -Definitely a a great FPS game, a fun story line and great multiplayer modes, spend most of my time with friends playing terrorist hunt where it can be 2-4 teammates set on a map with a bunch of AI Terrorist to clear out. Even the story mode is multiplayer for 2 people so id have to give this game a 8.5 / 10 for team based FPS games. Also love the hide and take cover options to stick to walls and cover, lol reminds me of gears of war. ** When running first time start up with this game about half way through it asks you to install PunkBuster anit cheat services, of course you can get it and it doesnt really mess anything up, but i havent seen 1 online match using it so everyone just clicks cancel and you can still play without getting PunkBuster and online so no worries :D**P.S. I run a amd 2.10 Ghz single core processor and amd ati radeon mobility 4200 with 320MB and i can run it fine with around 20-30 fps on all low graphics settings with a fan to cool the laptop, the graphics options customizing is a little lacking though so theres just a few presets, so hopefully this helps everyone rate whether they can run it or not.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6, 2016
												Rainbow Six Game with 4 player team ? where are the other 2? no, really...RS VEGAS 2 It's one of the must have FPS of all time. A job well done by Ubi. This isnt a typical run & gun FPS as other Ubi's title as we known as the most arguable FPS due to its own comunity atitude. Team coop & coordination is essential. Plan your move & use your tech right will save your team & progress through the game. The story mode is a 2 player coop-able.  It's more fun and challenging to do Realistic mode with friends. You lead 2 friendly ai & 1 hooman friend for you to command. Then, there's Terrorist Hunt mode which is more friendly & less-tactical play (cant use support gear such spycam, thermal map).[+] PRO's• No UPlay. definitly a YAY factor on Ubi games• the best avatar customization system for FPS. ever. i repeat....EVER !• coordination based FPS game. No run & gun• gun feel real, gun changing animation is as slow as real. dont reload until is safe or depleted. no lollygagin on this one• char lumbering feel real. you cant run as fast if you lumbered with gear that much. So be wathcfull for granade icons LoL :D• nice covering system. be friend with wall, be gooood friends• AI isnt great but good enough, even smarter than most of C*D player• good online & matchmaking system[-] CONS• The infamous gun loop bug. Hasn't been a fix since 1st release. thats ubi 4 u :D• no dlc whatsoever. too bad. i really hope there will be steam workshop enable for vegas2SCORE : 9/10  SPASniper horror game. be afraid, be very afraid of the SPAS-MAN...A MUST HAVE FPS!

Posted: June 26, 2015
												While I do have a lot of love for this game having spent a ridiculous number of hours playing it on the PS3, I just can't recommend the PC version as it seems to be completely random as to whether or not it will let you connect to the online features.Me and my brother both bought this on steam at the same time, eager to get hunting some terrorists and while my game connceted straight away to the online features my brothers did not. There seems to be no definitive reason for this online with many people saying they have experienced similar problems with some methods of solving the problem working and others not at all.So basically it seems that whether or not you can play this game online comes down to luck.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 26, 2015
												This game was great for the Xbox, but on PC at least two problems exist that really shouldn't.Issue 1: Multiplayer: "Cannot Connect to Host"Trying to play Terrorist Hunt with a friend equates to trying everything you can to establish a connection. Changing port settings; alterting your Firewall; using Hamachi; trying other software; and/or getting lucky. You can now play with one other person, maybe.Trying to play with strangers: "Cannot Connect to Host" for 95% of the time you attempt to connect to someones game. No-one ever joined my game, so they probably got the same error. You can eventually join someones game, for one match. When they try to switch the level => "Cannot Connect to Host."Issue 2:The machine gun sound glitch. As a Host I didn't experience this, but when I joined my friends game by the graces of god, I experienced the sound glitch within minutes. At this point, you turn off your sound or go insane.I didn't get the game for Singleplayer, but that experience is up in the air. I've spent more of my time attempting to connect to lobbies and getting re-directed to the main menu over and over instead of playing the game, so I'd suggest being cautious should you consider purchasing.
