content:
Posted: September 29, 2014
												Personal rating: 7/10Replayability: LowBudget: Worth it. Lenght: A few days. Ranbow Six is a tactical shooter, but unlike other tactical shooters I've tried, the game seems a little too forgiving and a bit more like a random FPS game. In this game, I rarely found myself in a pinch and often wondered why I even had a handgun, I never needed it with all the ammo I had. Turning up the difficulty didn't change this, it just meant I died more often, but dying didn't really feel like a failure in this game. It's a very decent game, and even many years after release, I found it good enough that I could enjoy playing it, but it's meant for Co-op and co-op only, on high difficulty. I'd still pick a game like SWAT 4 over this one, but that might not be a fair comparison. All in all, a good game.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2016
												Okay so I recommend the game if you always have at least one person to play with otherwise don't bother because there is no difficulty scaling for how many people are playing at one time and no matter which difficulty you choose you will die in one hit. The difficulty is changed by how many players you have at any one time.The idea the developers had was to make it hard enough that you wanted to bother someone else to play and then the awareness of this game would grow and spread through the connections people form over their lives. I cannot stand by this exploitation of games. If you have trouble making friends then games like these are just a sick pathetic attempt to gain popularity through dismissing ones abilities to overcome challenges.I have actually managed to complete the single player campaign on the hardest difficulty but the whole experience was absolutely horrible and condemning. Having to wait for the dumbest AI to try to flank me just so I can one hit kill them from blind cover with a spaz is so easy and gets so boring quickly you’ll find yourself trying to do something fun up until you are one hit killed and punished for how you choose to play the game.tl;dr versionGet the game if you have a friend you can play with

content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
												HOLY COW!okay finally got around to this review for a game thats literally past its prime.its VERY fun to play with friends, if you feel like signing up for Uplay.the story is ludicrous, the AI are♥♥♥♥♥♥tier, absolute garbage. even when you do everything right, you can count on them to not have your back, fail to engage enemies that they could easily stop from killing you from behind, Honestly during one level you get to play alone, and i find that i died much less, and got more done, without having to babysit two special ops officers... the worst, the "tutorial" is trash, and the AI begin thier campaign of dissapointment early by requring constant babysitting, not to mention you can kill them accidentally and you will!, watch them go into a room you just grenaded, let an enemy waltz right by them to spas12 you in the face. or generally just chill on the rappell rope not going up or down and just being generally bothersome. get it for the Terrorist hunt/versus mode. story is unplayable with AI try it with friends instead.It is Fun, just not with AI.7.5/10 Would become human swiss cheese again

content:
Posted: April 3, 2016
												I played so much of this game in a short time that I had to relearn some other games.Case in point: I was playing Alien: Isolation and right-clicked to try to take cover. I pulled out my revolver.The alien saw this and promptly ate my face off.10/10 would have strange dreams about Xenomorph Counter-Terrorism Units again.This game is a nice addition to the world of tactical shooters. It brings back the same gameplay from Vegas 1 with a new angle on the story through the eyes of a new protagonist. Just a word of advice: Walk softly and carry a big shotgun or sniper rifle.And beware of the infamous shotgun man. Shotgun man will find you.Shotgun man will kill you.Shotgun man will cause you to throw your mouse across the room in frustration.If you can survive a hit from shotgun man at close range, get up and buy a lottery ticket.Because you are pretty damn lucky, punk.

												It's somewhat fun although unbalanced. As someone who hasn't played a Rainbow game since Black Arrow on the original xbox, and this one was okay. Few issues here and there, little ugly, but it's okay. Few issues with the guns, the riot shield completly ruins single player with perfect accuracy pistols and a shield no NPC can shoot around or through. It's just a decent game I guess. I liked 3 much more however, I recommend trying one of the older games in the series. If you're a big fan, get Vegas, if you just want to try a Rainbow game, vegas will somewhat do the job. 6.8/10. It's nothing new to the tactical FPS genre, but it has a few fun moments.

content:
Posted: August 15, 2016
												Citizens come to biggest casino in Vegas city to win big jackpot in poker, slots and roulette games. The place is owned by underworld mafia who deals with drugs and illegal arms and bombs in town. It is surrounded by goons and thugs all time where cars are parked in the parking zone. Your mission is to storm into casino and kill gangsters while people are playing poker on table. You must figure a way out to kill all criminal gamblers playing cards in room. Blow enemy cars and vehicles into ashes, burst car wheels by firing bullets and don’t let them escape.Take your assault sniper rifle and start shooting mafia goons and thugs, prefer headshots. You played many car driving and crashing stunt games as a driver before. Now try this intense action packed fps game. As SWAT force captain, free the town from underworld mafia and destroy their drug cartel. End this crazy chaotic situation from streets of biggest resort city famous for gambling and exotic nightlife.Features:10 exciting and challenging action based missionsLethal weapons selection with assault sniper rifle and unlimited ammoRealistic city location with big open world and indoor environmentSmooth touch controls for best first person shooting experienceHigh quality 3D graphicsDone a lot poker and casino slots games with big wins, now play this amazing first person shooting game inside the gambling zone. Download Vegas Police Force Casino 3D game for real fun adventures and extreme challenges.

content:
Posted: June 1, 2016
												The game is just about dead. Don't buy it. It was a blast to play back in the day when peopleactually played it for what it was worth. I specifically bought it to experience the Team Leader versus mode, which was the bread and butter of this game.Very few people even play the versus modes, let alone Team Leader which nobody does.Terrorist hunt still has a decent amount of people playing, but I like I said that's notwhere this game truly shined. Besides that the customization is top notch.But the core game modes being abandoned and the scarcity of it all,just makes it not worth spending money on. I'd play SIEGE, or look elsewhere.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Rainbow Six Vegas 2 is a very challenging, well paced multi/single player game with a good replay-ability factor. Would definatly recommend it for you Tom Clancy fans or fans of really difficult games. With the Fear factor of being heavily outnumbered and only needing a few bullets to go down, teamwork is everything. Rushing in head first blasting your weapons everywhere will get you killed, making the most anxious of players need to slow down and use strategic well thought out plans. Also the ragdoll physics are fantasic making explosives some of the best weaons.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												Vegas 2 has to be my favorite out of the 'Rainbow Six' franchise. You play as Bishop, a Rainbow squad leader in charge of a small counter-terrorism unit. Your mission -- to track down the dangerous Cabrero cartel in possesion of deadly chemical agents through the city of Vegas. The fun and easy squad tactics combined with the unique environments and map layouts make for some interesting scenarios in taking out the bad guys. The graphics aren't too bad for its time, and the voice acting is exceptionally well done. One of the best parts about the game is its customizable elements. From your apparel to your combat loadout, you can tweak everything to your liking.The only downsides are a limited arsenal, a drawn-out leveling process, and a boring playing experience once you've earned all the gear and acheived prestige level. The three difficulty tiers all feel the same, as well.All other things aside, with campaign, versus mode, and the additional terrorist hunt mode, this game is quite a steal for $10. It's certainly worth your time.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
												Tom Clancy Rainbow Six Vegas 2Kita disini bertindak sebagai leader team, dan bertugas untuk memerintah dan memimpin pasukan kita. Tim kita sendiri terdiri dari 3 orang, dengan kata lain kita punya 2 kawan yang ikut serta dalam tim yang kita pimpin.Game ini menarik menurut ane, banyak fitur yang membuat game ini menjadi lebih seru.Jujur ane belum banyak mainin game Tom Clancy, Splinter Cell adalah satu satunya game Tom Clancy yang pernah ane mainkan selama ini.Balik lagi ke Rainbow Six Vegas 2,[] SULIT +Ya, game ini menurut ane sulit untuk dimainkan. Pasalnya, ane main mode normal aja udah kewalahan. Entah emang ane yang payah atau apa, tapi game ini beneran susah!! Tapi itu yang bikin game ini tambah seru[] Command +\-+ Di dalam game ini kita bisa memerintah pasukan kita seperti mengepung, menjebak, dan lain sebagainya. Ini bener -     bener asik!! Karena kita bisa berbagi tugas dengan kawan, dan kita juga bisa tag enemy yang kita prioritaskan.- Terkadang, ane kesel dengan bot temen se tim kita. Ada suatu waktu disaat ane menyuruh salah satu dari mereka untuk melempar Grenade ke arah musuh, ternyata dia malah melempar tepat di depan tempat ane berlindung. Untung ga mati. [] Karakter +Karakter utama di dalam game ini bisa kita ubah - ubah, dari wajah, hingga kaki. Begitu juga dengan aksesoris seperti pada kepala, mata, dan lain - lain. Semua itu membuat karakter kita punya ciri khas tersendiri, asik kan ?Jadi secara keseluruhan, game ini menarik dan menurut ane patut untuk dibeli. kalian ga bakalan nyesel kok beli game ini. Apalagi ada fitur coop, jadi kalian bisa menjalankan misi bareng temen kalian.Rate 8.5/10

content:
Posted: May 13, 2011
												Vegas 2 is a resoundingly OK game that is much better in co-op multiplayer than anything else. Even then the A.I. can be very easily exploited and there is a clear and not always sensible hierarchy in the strength of the guns. There's also a lot of dressup features for your character model.Not many people play the campaign multi but this is the only way the campaign is really worth doing so that's sad. I would gladly run through it with someone because I've played every co-op multi map 300 times probably.There's no matchmaking but the co-op "terrorist hunt" missions support four people and the story mode supports two with two AI teammates tagging along. There is a server browser and it's not awful but it's not incredible either.The competitive multiplayer is basically people trying to camp the enemy spawn and hitting each other with burst-fire rifles or the tactical shotgun.

content:
Posted: May 19, 2016
												This is the first Rainbow Six I've played properly and whilst It's short (only made longer by trial and error),inconsistent enemy and friendly AI (either really bad or really good) and the story/voice acting not interesting enough to engage me,I still really enjoyed this game up until the finish. Sometimes to the point where I struggled to put it down,I was having that much fun. The visuals are still good (I really enjoyed them for older style graphics),good amount of varying locations,but the best part is the combat (even If repetitive),mainly the cover system. I got this as part of the $10 RS bundle,but would recommend standalone on special. Keen to get stuck into the other one's now.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												AMAZING GAME,DONT BUY FOR PC!!!!!!I played R6V2 - LOVED it on Xbox 360, but for the PC it is Damn Near Unplayable. Despite what anyone says.There is a Bug with the Sound. I just played it for 2 hours, online Coop and let me tell you - This Game is BROKEN.I have heard that it happens in Multiplayer, both versus and Terrorist Hunt Coop... - Machine gun firing like crazy, caused when a Player or AI is killed while firing. It only happens when you don't host - apparently - and Completely Ruins the Sound of the game for the entire match.Whats Worse, Ubisoft has known about this glitch, and has had it reported by players. They give canned answers about updating Drivers or whatever - and have not issued a fix. the Game has been OUT on PC for More than 5 YEARS. Yet... Ubi wants money so bad that they wont work on anything but current projects? Or AT LEAST - Come Clean about the Issue and say its a Unfixable Bug?!Play this Gem on a Console. You will still get the bug like I did years ago - but RARELY. This Happened in Every Game I was just In, For 2 HOURS. You will be able to Enjoy the robust unlocking system and unique tactical gameplay... I am sad to report that for PC, this game is not even close to what it is on console.

												Purchased the game and tried to set up an online session with a friend. Clicked login after I had already logged in once and entered the code. I receive a message saying "Failed to initialize network service". I have scoured the internet and tried every possible fix I could find for this, short of reinstalling my OS. I have also attempted to contact Ubisoft about it several times. I have yet to receive and answer. So unless I just want to play it by myself, I have wasted $10.  Not recommending it simply due to the lack of support from Ubisoft in handling a very common issue that has existed since the game  came out.

number of helpful: 3 of 9 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2
												So for the current $3.39 sale, it's a decent game and you will get your money's worth back. That said:- the "story" is insanely short and completely forgettable. I played it 2 weeks ago and barely could remember what the hell we actually did.... - The "Terrorist Hunt" coop multiplayer is utter garbage. This game has nothing to do with tactics, like i.e. SWAT did. In Terrorist hunt the enemies don't spawn at your time and then react, no, scripts make them spawn wherever, even in completely cleared areas or LITERALLY next to your character. Beating some missions on realistic is just a giant chore and actual tactics just get you killed. You need to find a nice place to lure them into spawning into you, run back and then just slaughter them 1 by 1, otherwise some maps are impossible to win as enemies are regularly spawn coordinated to fall in your back.So if you want "actual tactics" try to buy SWAT 4 from ebay / amazon, buy ArmA 3 and do open combat or even Splinter Cell: Blacklist. This game is a quick fun game for four dollars, but not worth anything more.I have not played pure Multiplayer (human vs human, no buts or AI enemies) or looked for mods.

number of helpful: 9 of 23 people (39%) found this review helpful9 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 16, 2013
												Though certainly not the first game series to become worse with each new iteration, it seems that has been the trend with Rainbow Six for some time. However, even the mediocre Vegas 1 was pretty fun with it's four player co-op mode, and while a lot of the tactical elements were stripped away, we were still left with a competent, and occassionally intelligent shooter.Vegas 2 seems to take those few things that I really enjoyed about the first, removes them, and focuses more on the things that made the first Vegas not very good to begin with. Gone is four player co-op campaign (inexplicably reduced to two player), the ability to customize your soldier right out of the box (for the PC version), and decent map design. Instead, what we get was a tedious and unneccessary progression system of unlocks, AI that seems to wildly alternate between being braindead and clairvoyant, and weaker PC optimization. And not that anyone plays a Tom Clancy game for the story, but for this one, they didn't even write a new script; instead it's the same moronic terrorist attack on Las Vegas, but following a different group of Rainbows, this one even less interesting that the last.I can't think of one thing that was improved in this sequel, and a large amount of content was made worse. A lazy sequel to a mediocre game, and a lazy port for an almost entirely consolized series. My advice: if you want a good Rainbow Six game, try the original three, or if you want a less tactical game, play the original Vegas. There's nothing here that isn't offered in any of those games, and generally it is done in a way that is far less frustrating.

content:
Posted: April 7, 2015
												I wish I could reccomend this game, I really do. It's not terrible, but it has one flaw that breaks the game completely, friendly AI. This would not be an issue if you didn't need your two teammates to actually complete missions because of either story parts, or so many enemies you can't do it alone. Your teammates are pretty much crack shots with the minds of 6 year olds. There are times you have to tell them 20 times to rappel a wall in an empty room, Jung goes down every two seconds because he doesn't understand that if you're being shot, you take cover, they try to go two at a time through doors, and they easily manage to either clear a room full of 5 guys easy, then proceed to fail when they breach a wall fighting two. The AI is a hit or miss, and it's a miss 93% of the time. On the other hand, the enemy AI will headshot you at 1000m, rush you, frag you, and act like an actual fighting force, while you're two teammates act like they have mental deficiencies. Oh, and this is a minor story issue, but no one carries more than one type of breaching charge, which will later hurt them when you reach Act 3, but due to spoilers I'll leave what happens out. A note to Rainbow though, there's other breaching devices besides C4, such as battery rams, crowbars, and smaller, non-lethal ones that don't blow up the whole door, which were around by the time of this game's release and was most likely in use by all the regular SOF operators in the TC Universe. It's not a bad game, but the friendly AI is so bad I can't reccomend it, because they put so much need for you to have your AI and use them that it ruins the experience.

content:
Posted: February 13, 2014
												This game has two faces so bare with me for this one:I love playing this game. It's fun, exciting, descent graphics, good sound (their is a !!! large warning !!! about this though, more about that later)Both the single player and multieplayer are fun to play with and things like terrorist hunt where you can multieplayer with up to 4 people with your friends to swipe a level of terrorist never gets old. Their are some minor annoyances of jittersish AI behavior: sometimes they react very slowly and other times they virtually 'teleport' around the corner and make an instant headshot. But it's more then workable, the game is beatable and enjoyable even through this.You can customize your character a lot. Their are a whole range of skins, face features (mustaches, beards eyes) and that is just the face and body. You can equip different weapon sets per game and outfit your character with stuff you can unlock through gaining levels.This leveling element has been flashed out well, their is a lot to unlock. It doesn't feel tedious because the game is well playable without a lot of unlocks. And it feels rewarding, it is just plain fun to see new stuff become available and show off your rank as well as your individual levels on assualt, CBQ and marksmen tactics.The single player has a descent story and some interesting voice acting. It's no grande feast of fully inspired epic dialog and plot. But it's very enjoyable. Sometimes it takes a bit of good luck to get your AI colleges going and doing what they need to do, but again: it is more then workable and doesn't really halt the game in my opinion.I would love to keep playing this game, although their one big BUT:Their is a persistent sound bug that keeps popping up, mainly in multieplayer . The bug seams to trigger when their is full automatic gun fire (which their is almost constantly in a heated battle) and has a chance to keep looping.Imagine the rattling of an M16 or AK rifle and that it just keeps stuck. Mostly it's a gun causing the problem laying on the ground, if you can find it and pick it up it mostly disappears. But I also found a similar bug that isn't fixable through this and in general gets worse. The former bug is location bound, when you move away the sound is gone. This big however keeps going in any part of the game (in-agem, loading screen, main menu) and can even carry on inside your operating system. I am NOT kidding, I have tried to find the volume of the game in the Win7 volume control to mute it, disabled and enabled my sound card, but the only thing that works is rebooting your whole machine.Now you might think, what does this rattling about a bug have to do in a review. Well, I am not the only one that has this bug. This bug is widely known and many, many users experience it. Their are a multietude of 'solutions' but nothing seams to stick. We have widely different system and have since we started playing all upgraded our machines or bought new ones, but the bugs stay. The internet is littered with forums etc that are filled with people with the same problem, but never a solid solution is provided.I do not understand how they have been able to make a game based on the Unreal Engine that is this flawed in the audio department. You might argue that this game is a bit older, but I don't see it that way. This game has an active community and has a lot of stuff to unlock that you can only achieve by playing it a hell of a lot. In that regard I am very disappointing in both this game and Ubisoft for not providing the community with either a statement or a solution.If this game didn't have said bug, it would be an instance classic and in my opinion can go through the decades like Unreal Tournament 2K4, Medal of Honor: Pacific Assualt, Quake 3 Arena and Battle Field 1942.It's really a game you can pick up where you left off, have a whole lot of fun, but their is always room for improvement. A pure skill game that doesn't have game mechanics that just throw off the game balance like the new COD: Modern Warfare or the newer UT and Quake games that just didn't feel like anything we loved about the orginal format.For me Rainbow Six was always a miss, because the AI was terribly stupid and the game very hard to learn in general. This game isn't, I really enjoy playing it and explore everything it has. But for some reason I have to accept that I will have to endure regular persistent automatic gun fire blazing through my headphones that NEVER STOP.

content:
Posted: May 24, 2016
												Nice for multiplayer. But a catastrophy in single player.While it keeps the mechanics of Rainbow Six Vegas, the gameplay changes.The whole balance shifts heavily from a really tactical shooter, where you plan, prepare, then act to a more arcade-style shooter. that throws one nasty surprise at you after another. This means lots of situations where planning becomes hard, sudden tests of your reflexes, and many deaths that you dont feel responsible for. Add a few bugs (checkpoints not loading), missing features (restocking your ammo at the checkpoint must be repeated after every death, if you were low on ammo when you first arrived at the checkpoint. ) Also the AI of your team feels clumsy, they seem to stand in your way all the time.The multiplayer modes are all fine, especially co-op which is fine just like in the first game. Except that I had a bug, where the gunfire-sound did not stop after enemies died.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Vegas 2. The only franchise of games made by Ubisoft that's based truly on the works of the late great Tom Clancy, Rainbow Six is a long running series of tactical shooter games. This here is the latest entry in the series. Being the 'sequel' to RS: Vegas, this game (obviously) takes place in the city of Las Vegas. Team Rainbow must stop a series of terrorist attacks throughout the city. This is the same premise as the last game. Not only is the basic plot almost the same as te last game but, pretty much everything is. It doesn't feel like a sequel but rather an expansion pack or something.The difficulty is just horrendous when the buggy A.I. barely works. You going lone wolf most of the time with you team somewhere else. Another thing is the enemy A.I. They're ultimate deadeyes with guns. Their shots are just physically impossible to make in reality. (I assume) Currently, I can't think of anything that I liked about the game. 12 hours were invested to it trying make it work after my singleplayer data constantly kept deleting. That's it.

number of helpful: 3 of 14 people (21%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
												I played the original rainbow six for the playstation in my younger days. It was a game that at the time, I couldn't necessarily comprehend fully, but I still loved it. I kept meaning to look into a game that offered me the methodical tactical based "choose where your team enters and what they do" gameplay that the original offered. I considered getting swat 4, but I felt that rainbow six was probably going to be the better choice. This however, was merely nostalgia.In this game, you cannot select where you enter a conflict. There are set spawn points for you and your team and you cannot select any other spawn points or set your own at your descretion. You also seem to have less equipment or at least less equipment that isn't context sensitive, nor does your team really function like an actual counter-terrorism team. Or anything close to that. Your team are essentially two mediocre robots that you send out to either get shot or open doors. Not only do they lack personality but they're totally unnecessary. You could probably complete this entire game on the hardest difficulty with heavy armor, a heavy machine gun and nothing else. The maps aren't very creative in the way they're layed out. They're essentially layed out like counter-strike levels with enemy bots. If you want this type of experience, I recommend looking up a half-life 2 modification called "smod tactical" as it looks and feels better. It offers much more difficulty and you actually feel like you're doing something to your enemies. This brings me to the other negative of this game. The weapons simply don't feel powerful. Even the strongest weapons in the game feel like sub-machine-guns firing nine milimetre rounds. There's no intensity, barely any difficulty, little creativity and fairly little fun.If you're one of the people who might think this game might have a good story or good writing to carry the experience, then I regret to report that this game isn't what you're looking for either. From what I remember of the campaign, it felt like a typical call of duty game. Bad guys, shoot them. Help your personality lacking goons do something. Wait at the door until the scripted event triggers to open it. It isn't that fun, as a matter of fact I'd say that a call of duty might actually be better to buy than this. The gameplay in this is less fun and the level layouts are about as linear, if not more so. This game also has the distinct feeling of being a bit of a budget title. I've not researched the game's development, so I can't tell if it is one or not, but it certainly feels that way, and for a series that I would have called one of the greatest tactical shooters of all time at one point in my life, the fact that it has reached such a low note is tragic.This game is worth just about as much as it costs. Do not expect it to really satisfy you in any real way. I wouldn't tell you to outright avoid it, but it's not that great and I abandoned playing it a quarter of the way through. Opting for instant action instead of campaign.As a word of warning, I encountered a glitch with this game that made playing impossible. At one point, the game stopped registering mouse movement. I couldn't aim, shoot, look down my sights or anything that was done through the mouse. I tried plugging my xbox 360 controller in, it wouldn't register that either.

content:
Posted: December 25, 2016
												This game throws away the majority of things that made the previous game great. - The negative - It forces you to have bots during coop who can glitch by running very fast against walls like Sonic the Hedgehog. The player can also run in place instead of leaning when using cover. AKs dropped from enemies can fire indefinitely (making it impossible to hear what's happening in game due to how many times it can happen and how loud the AKs are). Players are seen teleporting during level transitions. The main character's speeches with the bots are unnecessary and break the immersion. During coop, your partner shouts anything he does, from removing his suppressor to changing the combat mode of the AI.Ubisoft somehow made the UI for the character customization worse than the first game by not adapting it for PC. On the title screen, it takes forever to spin your character when you drag your mouse on screen. You're not given access to every gun and outfit right at the beginning. Instead, you have to complete challenges (like shooting 10 bad guys at a long distance) that should be optional and then unlock what you want with points. Boxes can be found during missions that you can use to change your loadout and appearance. However, enemies can still come kill you while you're in the menus and the bots are useless to protect you. If you dare put the difficulty on realistic, snipers can eliminate you in one hit without clear feedback that you've been spotted.The options are in a submenu named extras when they should be visible on the first screen. The game forces you to restart after changing the aspect ratio. You can only walk from toggling and it's barely noticeable compared to moving normally. The multiplayer is unstable and you might need to host multiple times until it finally works. The logo from Unreal Engine 3 is used on Windows' taskbar and the volume mixer instead of the game's logo. - Mixed - You're forced to carry two main weapons + a sidearm. This is unpleasing from a realistic standpoint. All of your controls except movement are removed during story segments. Your name doesn't show up when you die. Instead, you're given the name of the story character. - The positive - The map and thermal vision look good. The gunplay feels nice like in Vegas 1.I've only played 1 hour of this game and I can only imagine deliberate self-harm for anyone playing through the full game.

												Got this game for nostalgia's sake. Used to play this game for hours with my big brother and was super happy to see how inexpensive it was. Not much of a keyboard and mouse player (very tiny apartment, frankly I don't have the room. If I want to use a keyboard and mouse I legit have to lay down. Not great for fps.) And frankly I regret purchasing this now. So unless you're lucky enough for the forum fixes to work, or you prefer keyboard and mouse, don't bother. A big let down for something I was very excited for.

content:
Posted: December 1, 2015
												Reminds me of Spec Ops: The Line, but with a complete stealth take. Vegas 2 is..almost the definition of tactical. Mechanics have you planning out your work. (You can do a basic breach and clear with either a frag or a flash by commaning your fellow operatives to do so. You can make them "stack up" by a door, while you work your way around and find a window to storm in from. From there, you can give them the word to breach while you come in from those windows behind.) Again, decisions matter in this game.  Also has a good customization system (unfortunately you can't save your customization but the game gives you no time limit) I can certainly recommend this to the tactical first and third person shooter player. Especially to those who have a 64 bit, Windows 7 Operating System.

Posted: February 23, 2014
												Play dis nao, it is so underrated and is possibly one of my most favorate games in my library. Yeah sure the graphics are not up to par even for 2006-2008 standards, but thats just because it focused more into the gameplay aspects of it. Sometimes the computer can get random insta-kill headshots out of nowhere, but just knowing that makes you feel much more vulnerable. You have to play this game tactically, you CAN run and gun because of the faster pace of the game, but you are REALLY going to balance things out, to know when to go in and when to stay back and toss a nade, thats what makes this game so fun. Its 10$, even less with sales that happen frequently, meaning its a cheap, fun game you can play with your friends, or forever alone if you have no friends. I highly recommend this game, worth every penny.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2014
												This is a solid little game in the action shooter franchise but don't go expecting too much from it. While it definitely looks pretty and is fairly satisfying to play it suffers a serious case of "xbox port-itis". Many of the seperate action buttons have been combined into press and hold menus which, while perfect for a controller, really is a pain for anyone used to PC gaming. In addition, the multiplayer and co-op connections are a mild pain, though both do usually work. Finally, be aware you must create an ubisoft account, even when playing through Steam.Like other later Tom Clancy franchise games, this one too only dabbles in realism while being a console game at heart. Being able to take a shotgun blast and live. Shot teammates can be magically resurected with one quick jab of a needle. Super human accuracy on full automatic. Just don't go expecting something like the original Rainbow Six or Ghost Recon titles. The ability to customize your operative with a variety of unlockable load outs, armor, and gear is a nice touch but there is very little point to use too many guns past the initial offering you start with and all other choices seem to be almost purely cosmetic. However, pulling off trick shots and specific kill types in the game to unlock things is a satisfying reward as you grind through the play.All in all, I considered it well worth the money after buying it on sale. You'll likely play through it once, enjoy your time, and then have no further use for it.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2014
												I'm reviewing this purely based on the 'Terrorist Hunt' mode; which could be a game in itself. To me, Rainbow Six Vegas 2 was the last great military FPS. In a market flooded with Call Of Duty and Battlefield and (to an extent) ARMA, Rainbow Six Vegas 2 stands out to me as the most fun, replayable game of all of them. Playing Terrorist Hunt is a massively tense solo experience and a brilliantly funny multiplayer experience. No matter how you play, this game accommodates for your style. It will make you think slowly and strategically about your actions, something that modern FPSs seem to have completely forgotten about. The innovative mechanics, such as rappelling, ropes and ladders add a degree of verticality to the maps, making them replayable to an almost infinite extent.If you have (somehow) never played this game, you owe it to yourself to experience one of the greatest and most original first person shooters of this generation.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 23, 2012
												I got into this game thinking that it was going to be amazingly realistic. And was I ever wrong! Firstly, you can't run and dive whilest shooting two pistols at once. You also have this heavy, sluggish armor on so you move very slow. Even when you sprint. Can you believe that? But, to be honest, I think the worst part is that when you rappel down buildings, you can no longer flip upside down. WHAT WERE THEY THINKING?!1?Tom Clancy needs to go back to school and learn how real close quater combat scenarios work, because I've seen plenty of live news feeds where cops are diving behind cars and blindly lobbing flash bangs at enemy combatants. I've also witnessed a Special Tactics And Rescue Services member use a dead body as a human shield when infilitrating an underground facility. And guess what?? You can't use human shields in this game.In conclusion, Ubisoft really dropped the ball with this sequel. Co-op, Schmo-op. Fix the game play and then maybe I'll edit my review.

												Best Multiplayer Shooter ever. The game may be dead now but if you have friends(sadly I don't) play a game on just about any map(Convention Center/Theater/Firing range better maps imo) and play without armor. The game is a little clunky but not a DayZ Clunky(ladders/ropes/switching guns slow animations). You throw grenades like a weakling so aim up higher. Some of the funnest FPS games I've ever played online were from this game. Also the Famas<3. Watch FeaRed x on YT it will make you want to play again. Also for 10 bucks the game is worth it. The game just like every other FPS game has certain gimmicks. I'm not going to explain them but an example would be like CoD has dropshotting, R6 doesn't have dropshotting but other things such as sprint shotting. You can shoot through walls so don't hang on the wall forever. Have fun still my favorite game after almost 8 years.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 29, 2015
												Good, but my only complaint is that the AI of your teammates is extremely stupid.  Maybe it's just because this game is a little dated, but it really makes it annoyingly difficult.  Your squad is about as useful as a group of toddlers, and it pretty much feels like you're baby sitting a couple of brainless man childs.  They just crawl around and only shoot if the enemy is right in their face, and lack basic human knowledge.  Most people know to run if a grenade falls in their lap, but Mike and Jung prefer to sit there and let it blow their face up.  The worst part is that if they die before you can heal them, the mission fails, yet if you are dying they don't help you up, which hardly seems fair.  Half the time I have died, it's been because a teammate has refused to move out of the way when I'm running for cover.  For a game based so heavily on teamwork, it would be nice for the squad members to actually feel useful rather than a bunch of bumbling idiots that are a chore to look after.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Decent combat shooter game for it's time. Decent weapon balistics and realism with some fun practical mechanics like fast rope, night and thermal vision, weapon customization and soldier customization. Soldiers have available a myriad of body armors and various combat wear available after ranking up, as well as various camoflauges to further customize and cultivate the look you want your elite squad to portray on the battlefield.  Weapon customization has a number of attachments that you can utilize to improve your aim as well as get the edge you need in close quarters or long range combat.  The ability to mark targets in singleplayer and multiplayer modes is the key squad mechanic laid at your disposal. If you enjoyed full reign over your squad mates like in previous Rainbow Six titles, such as Ravenshield, you'll be a bit disappointed. If you are just coming into the franchise however, I highly recommend this game for it's enjoyable, albeit slightly cliche singleplayer experience.  Once that is finished there is an independant terrorist hunt mode, like in previous titles, and you can use that mode to further rank and hone your skiils.   I did not get to spend a great deal of time in competitive multiplayer as finding matches when I played this game the most, the community had already moved on to other new titles like Call of Duty and Battlefield Bad company.  Either way, it's worth its current price tag and a few play throughs with a friend both in cooperative campaign and some terrorist hunt modes.  Good hunting.

												This is a very fun game to play with your friends.  However, if you plan on playing solo, my advice is this:  Don't.  The AI (or lack of for that matter) is what really makes me not enjoy this game.  Don't get me wrong, this is a great game to play co-op, but the singleplayer experience was just wrong.  This isn't one of those hipster "So bad it's good" cases.  I laughed the first few times my AI teammates did something stupid, but that got old very quickly.  Overall I give this game 2 out of 5 flashbangs.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 29, 2016
												Aged a lot better than RS Vegas 1 and is vastly superior in terms of mechanics, enjoyment and replay ability. This is a good example of a sequel doing things right. Sadly it loses some of the mechanics that make the RS Raven Shield/Gold Edition so good such as the tactical compulsive borderline obsessive mission/team planning (which is missed) but to its credit it’s also a lot more streamlined and actually playable (decent controls and graphics which still hold up relatively well).In Short Rainbow Six is about Squad Based Tactics.  In long...The single player provides an action packed campaign in which you and your squad can either use stealth to clear rooms of terrorists and take advantage of the element of surprise or go in guns blazing and learn the hard way that your fragile life is easily taken by AI who can even kill you (even in cover) to the point that you end up always sending your squad in first because you realize that the CPU AI is so much better than this at you after you have been spoilt by easy shooters and recovery mechanics. You will hopefully adapt to this and find it much more enjoyable after some brief upset...There is multiplayer but I'm not really into that. The good news is the progression system for multiplayer spans the whole game so even in single player you gain xp for kills and special points for killing enemy with headshots etc. which unlocks new weapons, outfits, armors, accessories and camouflage patterns. This is something you don’t really see a lot on the single player side of things and adds replay value. The progression system does take a long time to get to the top tier though which was intended for multiplayer longevity i assume.Other than a campaign (which is also co-op) there is Terrorist Hunt Mode (also co-op) which is a waking nightmare on hard... especially without the AI assisting you. One would assume you are hunting down the terrorists as it is sold to you as a mode of killing all terrorists in the area. The sad truth is it is the terrorists that are in fact hunting YOU (and your friend/team).In Summary I recommend it on the campaign/mechanics alone. It's a simple and enjoyable game from yesteryear and is a great laugh alone or with a friend.

content:
Posted: May 28, 2016
												This game is fantastic fun with friends, but I'd be really careful around the PC port. It's really clear the interface was NOT designed around a keyboard and mouse. You have to use the mouse really awkwardly with the equipment and weapon menus, and the default control scheme is outright awful. The port also has some really weird bugs too; the amount of times me and my friends have encountered an infinite gunfire sound effect is ridiculous, and it seems the only fixes for it include enabling V-Sync.I will recommend this game to anyone who wants a good time with friends, but be wary that this is clearly a halfassed Ubisoft PC port.

												I got this because it was on sale super cheap and because I remember really liking Vegas 1 back when it came out. Don't really remember the vegas 1 gameplay but this game is surprisingly hard. Even on normal difficulty, you CANNOT just run & gun, spray&pray like you can in most COD campaigns. You've got to think and plan ahead because in many cases your character is 1 shot kill. To that end, I send my squad in ahead of me and get few kills of my own in the campaign, which is fine because it's still fun. I have fun in some shooters because I just get to shoot everything that moves (L4D). I have fun in this game because it makes me think
